feature1.explanation: Both texts use commas effectively to separate items in a list and to set off introductory elements.

feature2.explanation: Both texts exhibit a similar level of lexical complexity and choice of words related to financial misconduct.

feature3.explanation: The sentence structures in both texts are concise and direct, with a mix of short and medium-length sentences.

feature4.explanation: Both texts convey a tone of criticism and disbelief towards the actions described.

feature5.explanation: No notable spelling or typographical errors were found in either text.

overall.explanation: Taking into account the analysis of all features, there is moderate confidence that the two texts were written by the same author.
